name: Infrastructure Issues & Outages
description: High-severity filter for live production-impacting infrastructure problems: outages, service unavailability, regional degradation, critical performance regressions, data-plane failures, and urgent remediation actions. Excludes routine operations, scheduled maintenance, informational updates, healthy status reports, internal engineering planning, and non-urgent workflow chatter.
positive_samples: Critical: production API error rates spiked from 0.3% to 28% in the last five minutes—investigation underway.
Alert: authentication service is fully unavailable, login attempts failing globally.
URGENT: database cluster experiencing failover loop; reads and writes stalled across all shards.
Incident declared: EU region reporting 60% latency increase and intermittent 5xx across core endpoints.
Production deploy rollback in progress due to persistent request timeouts impacting customer transactions.
High severity: message queue backlog growing uncontrollably, consumers failing to process messages.
Gateway routing failure: 40% of traffic receiving malformed responses, incident response engaged.
Network partition detected between core services and storage backend, causing cascading failures.
Hotfix required: corrupted cache entries causing incorrect data served to live users.
Pager triggered: autoscaling group stuck in unhealthy state—instances failing startup consistently.
Live incident: file storage returning intermittent 500s, impacting user uploads and media retrieval.
Production job scheduler malfunctioning—critical workflows not executing as expected.
Service mesh experiencing routing instability, causing intermittent service unreachable errors.
Major outage: payment processing pipeline halted due to upstream dependency timeouts.
Critical degradation: real-time analytics pipeline losing >30% of events due to worker crashes.
Persistent error: TLS certificate misconfiguration blocking production traffic in APAC.
Backend CPU saturation on primary nodes causing immediate production traffic throttling.
Data corruption detected in live environment—writes temporarily disabled to prevent further damage.
DNS misconfiguration propagating externally—customers unable to resolve our API endpoints.
Production Kafka cluster unreachable; producers failing and retry queues overflowing.
Full outage: container orchestration control plane down; cannot schedule or restart services.
Incident: memory leak causing sequential service crashes every 15 minutes in the core API.
Partial outage: CDN edge nodes returning 503 for static assets in multiple regions.
Firewall rules pushed incorrectly—external traffic blocked across all environments.
Storage cluster hitting I/O saturation, blocking read/writes and causing API stalls.
Critical alarm: replication lag exceeds 2 hours on primary DB—eventual consistency breaking assumptions.
Service degradation: content indexing service not updating, causing stale results to users.
Realtime feature flag service failing to propagate updates—critical configurations stale.
Major data-plane issue: internal RPC calls timing out between microservices.
Backend container crash loops triggered by misconfigured secrets in production.
Production Redis cluster eviction spike causing missing session data.
Global outage triggered by expired authentication token for internal service-to-service traffic.
API throttling incorrectly applied to premium customers due to configuration drift.
Production ETL pipeline stuck; no data delivered to analytics dashboard for last 3 hours.
High alert: live traffic exceeding capacity limits—emergency scale-up blocked by provisioning error.
Persistent disk failures detected on primary storage nodes—risk of data loss.
Deployment rollback failed, leaving partial version mismatch across services.
Production rate limiter malfunctioning, denying legitimate user requests.
Critical: service experiencing heap exhaustion, causing cascading JVM restarts.
